author: maxkingusa
body: I am going to start scaling into PSTG next week if we get a pullback.  I start my position on Thursday. PSTG has been winning storage deals away from Dell and NetApp.  Cost, Performance, and reliability favor PSTG.

author: NocNocNoc19
body: Im not sure how much money you have to start with. Vanguard index funds have been my overall best investment. Voo, VTI, VT. if you dont have enough to buy whole shares of those robin hood offers fractional shares but I have never gone that route so I honestly don't know how good of a thing they are. Other then that do a lot of research. Read a lot. Dont buy and think your going to sell again any time soon. Ive only been actually investing for about 2 years. In that time I have only sold 1 position because I no longer liked the investment long term. Everything else i have bought with the intent to hold for 10+ years baring something extremely unforeseen. I buy a lot of blue chips and companies im somewhat familiar with as well. I work in tech so I own cisco, palo alto, fortinet, netapp because I work with there products a lot. But i probably only own about 30 individual companies and over 50% of my portfolio is in those index funds i mentioned earlier. Is this winning advice, I have no idea but its been working for me.

author: briannco
body: NTAP is a lost cause. You buying a lot of coal stocks too?

author: yukhateeee
body: I don't follow PAYX closely, so I could be wrong. They're a well-regarded / well-managed company. Companies like that are difficult to short.  People keep buying the dips, so they don't go down as much as you want, nor stay down for long.

author: TheLoneComic
body:
Paychex, to be on topic, has a long history of organic growth, but not being an industry group leader will probably hurt it as the economic contraction really starts to take hold, probably starting as early as right after this Independence Day weekend or a couple weeks thereafter.

Not to be one of those the sky is falling people, the markets as well as the economy have been showing resilience and surprise here and there despite the massive wave of bankruptcies, student loan defaults, stay closed small business environment and more tsunami-ing toward us.

It’s gonna hammer, but remember the old market adage- it’s always a sunny day on Wall Street.

author: amoctar
body: Who's following payx for earnings next week?

author: johnnyappleseedgate
body:
yes.

&#x200B;

I have worked jobs I loved that paid me 50% less than jobs I have hated.

I think it pays off in the long run because you tend to work harder at things you enjoy so despite the initial pay cut I suspect that 2-3 years down the line you'll be making more money than if you took a job you didn't like (because you will have put more effort in and people can tel you actually enjoy your work) AND you will have a job you like.
